what: Differential Language Analysis with Topics and N-grams
title: topics
text: topics pipeline designed seamless transition raw text statistically grounded visualizations. composed following steps: 1. Data Preprocessing Transform raw text Document-Term Matrix (DTM) extract n-grams. step handles cleaning, including removal stopwords punctuation, prepare data modeling frequency analysis. 2. Model Training topic modeling, LDA (Latent Dirichlet Allocation) model trained DTM. Users can specify number topics iterations optimize thematic representation corpus. 3. Model Inference model inference step uses trained LDA model infer topic-term distribution across documents, converting qualitative text quantitative topic loadings. 4. Statistical Analysis Perform Differential Language Analysis (DLA) using topicsTest(). analysis now supports: * Automatic Detection: Intelligent per-variable method detection (e.g., automatically applying logistic regression binary factors linear regression continuous data). * Multi-Element Analysis: Statistically test LDA topics n-grams. * Rigorous Controls: Support control variables various p-value adjustment methods multiple comparisons (e.g., FDR, Bonferroni, Holm). 5. Visualization Generate publication-ready visualizations results: * Wordclouds: Create clouds significant topics word size reflects contribution theme. * N-gram Plots: Directly visualize relationship specific phrases variables interest.

title: Document Term Matrix — topicsDtm
text: data (list) list containing text data entry belonging unique id ngram_window (list) minimum maximum n-gram length, e.g., c(1,3) stopwords (stopwords) stopwords remove, e.g., stopwords::stopwords("en", source = "snowball") removalword (string) Character vector words remove; e.g., "word1" c("word1", "word2", ...) pmi_threshold (integer; experimental) Pointwise Mutual Information (PMI) measures association terms comparing co-occurrence probability individual probabilities, highlighting term pairs occur together often expected chance; implementation, terms average PMI specified threshold (pmi_threshold) removed document-term matrix. occurance_rate (numerical) occurance rate (0-1) removes words occur less (occurance_rate)*(number documents). Example: training dataset 1000 documents occurrence rate set 0.05, code remove terms appear less 49 documents. removal_mode (string) Mode removal -> one c("none", "frequency", "term", "percentage"). frequency removes words certain frequency certain frequency, indicated removal_rate_least removal_rate_most. term removes absolute number terms frequent least frequent. percentage removes number terms indicated removal_rate_least removal_rate_most relative number terms matrix removal_rate_most (integer) rate frequent words removed, functionality depends removal_mode removal_rate_least (integer) rate least frequent words removed, functionality depends removal_mode shuffle (boolean) Shuffle data analyses lower (boolean) TRUE, converts text lowercase embedding. remove_punctuation (boolean) TRUE, replaces non-alphanumeric characters spaces. remove_numbers (boolean) TRUE, replaces numerical digits spaces. stem_lemma_function (function). custom function stemming lemmatization. verbose Logical. TRUE, displays progress bars status updates text vectorization embedding process. Defaults FALSE. seed (integer) seed set reproducibility threads (integer) number threads use; also called cpu (CreateDtm).

title: N-grams — topicsGrams
text: data character vector texts data.frame/tibble (first column used text). ngram_window Integer vector specifying n-gram sizes. length 1, n used (e.g., 2). length 2 increasing, interpreted inclusive range (e.g., c(1, 3) -> 1,2,3). Otherwise treated explicit set (e.g., c(1, 3) means 1 3). stopwords Character vector stopwords remove (e.g., stopwords::stopwords("en", source = "snowball")). removalword Character vector words remove raw text prior tokenization. pmi_threshold Numeric PMI threshold used filter multi-word n-grams. NULL, PMI filtering skipped. occurance_rate Numeric [0,1]. Terms removed occur fewer round(N_docs * occurance_rate) - 1 documents, N_docs number texts. Example: 1000 documents occurance_rate = 0.05, terms occurring fewer ~50 documents removed. removal_mode Character. Removal mode passed filter_ngrams(). Common options include "frequency" "percentage" (depending helper implementation). removal_rate_most Numeric. Rate/threshold removing frequent n-grams (interpreted filter_ngrams() according removal_mode). removal_rate_least Numeric. Rate/threshold removing least frequent n-grams (interpreted filter_ngrams() according removal_mode). shuffle Logical. TRUE, texts shuffled (seed-controlled) processing. original ids preserved output. lower Logical. TRUE, text lowercased prior tokenization. remove_punctuation Logical. Passed quanteda::tokens(remove_punct = ...). remove_numbers Logical. Passed quanteda::tokens(remove_numbers = ...). stem_lemma_function Optional function applied tokens (via quanteda::tokens_apply()). accept return character vector tokens. verbose Logical. TRUE, prints simple progress messages (implemented). seed Integer. Random seed used shuffle = TRUE. threads Integer. Number threads used quanteda via quanteda_options(threads = ...). top_frequent Integer NULL. set, keeps top_frequent frequent n-grams filtering (recommended large corpora). NULL, keeps retained n-grams. freq_per_user_format Output format freq_per_user: "wide" Wide document--ngram table (may large). "long" Long sparse table columns id, ngram, rel_freq. "auto" Uses wide format N_docs * N_ngrams <= max_wide_cells; otherwise returns long. max_wide_cells Numeric. Safety limit "auto": N_docs * N_ngrams exceeds , freq_per_user returned long format avoid dense allocation excessive memory use.

text: model (list) trained model. data (tibble) text variable want infer topic distribution. can data used create dtm new data. num_iterations (integer) number iterations run model. sampling_interval number iterations consecutive samples collected. Gibbs Sampling process. technique, known thinning, helps reduce correlation consecutive samples improves quality final estimates ensuring independent. Purpose: specifying sampling_interval, avoid collecting highly correlated samples, can lead robust accurate topic distributions. Example: sampling_interval = 10, algorithm collects sample every 10 iterations (e.g., iteration 10, 20, 30, etc.). Typical Values: Default: 10; Range: 5 50 (depending complexity size data). burn_in number initial iterations discarded Gibbs Sampling process. early iterations may representative final sampling distribution model still stabilizing. Purpose: burn_in period allows model converge stable state collecting samples, improving quality inferred topic distributions. Example: burn_in = 50, first 50 iterations Gibbs Sampling process discarded, sampling begins afterward. Typical Values: Default: 50 100 Range: 10 1000 (larger datasets complex models may require longer burn-period). seed (integer) seed set reproducibility. create_new_dtm (boolean) applying model new data (used training), can help make new dtm. Currently experimental, using textmineR::CreateDtm() function rather topicsDtm() function, functions.

Default: "mean". user_spec_topics vector user-specified topics highlight scatter plot. Default: NULL. allow_topic_num_legend Logical; TRUE, displays topic numbers legend. Default: FALSE. scatter_show_axis_values Show values axises. y_axes_1 Specifies axis alignment scatter legend. Options: 1 (x-axis) 2 (y-axis). title: topics 0.66
text: Performance & Robustness * topicsGrams() speed-: Rebuilt n-gram per-document frequency computation using single sparse-matrix pass quanteda, replacing slow per-n-gram regex counting loop (major runtime improvement medium/large datasets). * Memory-safe output: freq_per_user now avoids accidental sparse → dense coercion (“allocating GiB” warning). supports auto wide/long output, returning long format wide large. Harmonization topicsDtm() * Aligned settings & reproducibility: topicsGrams() now mirrors topicsDtm() preprocessing controls (e.g., lower, punctuation/numbers removal, removalword, shuffle, seed, threads, optional stemming/lemmatization hook) returns saved settings list output.
